en: My train left Kyoto at six, and arrived in Tokyo at nine.
zh: 我坐的那趟火车六点从京都出发，九点到的东京。

en: I had hardly gotten into bed when the telephone began to ring.
zh: 我刚躺下，电话就响了。

en: I owe it to my uncle that I succeeded in my business.
zh: 我生意能成功全靠我叔叔。

en: I don't know whether I will win or lose.
zh: 我不知道自己会赢还是会输。

en: The young man whom I employed as my assistant works very hard.
zh: 我雇来当助手的那个小伙子干活挺卖力的。

en: Would you read my letter and correct the mistakes, if any?
zh: 能帮我读一下这封信，顺便改下错别字吗？

en: It was in Kyoto that I first met her.
zh: 我第一次见到她是在京都。

en: My first attempt at a cheesecake tasted horrible.
zh: 我第一次做的芝士蛋糕难吃死了。

en: I'll offer him what help I can.
zh: 只要能帮的，我都会帮他。

en: There was no sign of dinner appearing before I left.
zh: 我走之前还没见有开饭的迹象。

en: Thank you for reminding me about the meeting I have to attend.
zh: 谢谢你提醒我要去开会。

en: Please look after my cats while I'm away.
zh: 我不在的时候，麻烦帮我照顾下猫。

en: The people whom I meet are kind.
zh: 我遇到的人都挺善良的。

en: I'll get it.
zh: 我来接吧。

en: Please don't forget to put stamps on the letters I gave you to post.
zh: 别忘了在我给你寄的那些信上贴邮票。

en: Please don't forget to put stamps on the letters that I gave you to mail.
zh: 别忘了把我给你的信贴上邮票寄出去。

en: It was disappointing that nobody ate the expensive sushi I had served.
zh: 我准备了那么贵的寿司竟然没人吃，真让人失望。

en: I was about to go out, when the telephone rang.
zh: 我刚要出门，电话就响了。

en: I was just about to go out when the phone rang.
zh: 我正准备出门呢，电话就响了。

en: I was about to leave home when an old friend of mine dropped in.
zh: 我正要出门，一个老朋友突然来了。

en: Please take care of my birds while I am away.
zh: 我不在的时候，请帮我照看下我的鸟。

en: My father was still at home when I left.
zh: 我走的时候我爸还在家。

en: He arrived after I had left.
zh: 他是在我走了之后才到的。

en: How long will it take me to finish my homework?
zh: 我还要写多久作业才能写完？

en: The place I live in is very good for your health.
zh: 我住的这个地方对身体健康挺有好处的。

en: The message I received said, Please contact us at your convenience.
zh: 我收到的消息说，请在您方便的时候联系我们。

en: Would you like me to help you?
zh: 需要我帮忙吗？

en: The teacher I wrote to you about has not yet arrived.
zh: 我之前跟你提过的那个老师还没到。

en: What I have in my hand is a fossil seashell.
zh: 我手里拿的是个贝壳化石。

en: The deal I was working on fell through.
zh: 我谈的那桩生意吹了。

en: Are you suggesting that I am too young?
zh: 你是在暗示我太年轻了吗？

en: Are you suggesting that I'm too young?
zh: 你是想说我年纪太小了吗？

en: Were I young, I would go abroad.
zh: 我要是还年轻，就出国了。

en: If I were young, I would go abroad.
zh: 如果我年轻的话，我就出国了。

en: It took me five hours to drive from here to Tokyo.
zh: 我从这儿开车到东京花了五个小时。

en: When I didn't know how to answer the question, he gave me a hint.
zh: 我不知道怎么回答那个问题的时候，他给了我点提示。

en: When I failed, he said, "It serves you right".
zh: 我失败的时候，他说：“你活该。”

en: Nobody will believe how sorry I was for what I'd done.
zh: 没人会相信我对所做的事有多后悔。

en: All I have is books.
zh: 我这儿除了书啥都没有。

en: All I have is a book.
zh: 我这儿就只有一本书。

en: Please take a look at the picture that I chose.
zh: 请看下我选的这张照片。

en: I have not more than three thousand yen.
zh: 我身上也就不到三千日元。

en: Can you guess what I have?
zh: 你猜我手里拿的是什么？

en: Don't phone me while I'm at the office.
zh: 我在办公室的时候别给我打电话。

en: The friend who I thought would pass the exam failed it.
zh: 我以为能考上的那个朋友竟然没考过。

en: I'll leave my daughter's education to you, after I'm gone.
zh: 我不在了以后，我女儿的教育就全靠你了。

en: It is not surprising that I was elected mayor.
zh: 我当选市长一点儿也不奇怪。

en: We used to swim every day when we were children.
zh: 我们小时候每天都去游泳。

en: He would often come to see us when I was a child.
zh: 我小时候他经常来看我们。

en: That's not the reason why I said the job wasn't easy.
zh: 那不是我说这活儿不容易的原因。

en: What I bought yesterday was these shoes.
zh: 我昨天买的是这些鞋。

en: This desk, which I bought yesterday, is very big.
zh: 我昨天买的那张桌子特别大。

en: The boy whom I met yesterday is Tony.
zh: 我昨天遇到的那个男生是托尼。

en: The name of the man I met yesterday is Mr. Hill.
zh: 我昨天见到的那个人叫希尔先生。

en: It was Jack that I met yesterday.
zh: 我昨天遇到的是杰克。

en: It was a bag that I lost in the room yesterday.
zh: 我昨天在房间里弄丢的是个包。

en: What has become of the book I put here yesterday?
zh: 我昨天搁这儿的那本书哪儿去了？

en: I was called into the office first.
zh: 我是第一个被叫进办公室的。

en: It is ten years ago that I saw him last.
zh: 上次见他已经是十年前的事了。

en: People I admire most are those who do not see life in terms of power.
zh: 我最佩服的是那些不以权力衡量生活的人。

en: Though I refused repeatedly, he insisted that I should go there.
zh: 虽然我再三拒绝，他还是坚持要我去。

en: Will you help me get over the difficulties?
zh: 你能帮我度过这个难关吗？

en: The man helped me when I was in trouble.
zh: 我遇到麻烦的时候，那个人帮了我。

en: It was really considerate of you to lend me $500 when I was in difficulties.
zh: 我困难的时候你借我500美元，真的太体贴了。

en: Thank you very much for lending me $500 when I was having difficulty making ends meet.
zh: 太感谢你在我手头紧的时候借给我500美元了。

en: What I am talking about right now is the deep love and respect I have for my husband.
zh: 我现在说的是我对丈夫深深的爱和敬意。

en: I owe what I am to my parents.
zh: 我有今天全靠我父母。

en: I owe what I am to my friend.
zh: 我有今天全靠我朋友。

en: I owe what I am to my mother.
zh: 我有今天全靠我妈妈。

en: My father made me what I am.
zh: 是我父亲造就了今天的我。

en: My uncle has made me what I am today.
zh: 是我叔叔造就了今天的我。

en: I owe what I am today to Dr. Brown, who saved my life.
zh: 我能有今天多亏了救过我的布朗医生。

en: I owe what I am today to education.
zh: 我能有今天全靠受过的教育。

en: I will have been to Paris five times when I go there again.
zh: 下次再去巴黎的话，我就已经去过五次了。

en: It was George that I met in the street this morning.
zh: 我今天早上在街上遇到的是乔治。

en: This is all the money that I have now.
zh: 这就是我现在所有的钱了。

en: I'm sure it must be true from all that I've heard.
zh: 从我听到的这些来看，我敢肯定这绝对是真的。

en: Of all the places I've been, Alaska is the most beautiful.
zh: 在我去过的所有地方里，阿拉斯加是最漂亮的。

en: I owe it you that I am still alive.
zh: 我能活下来全多亏了你。

en: I owe what I am today to my parents.
zh: 我能有今天多亏了我父母。

en: Repeat what I have just told you.
zh: 把我刚才跟你说的话重复一遍。

en: No sooner had I entered the hall than the ceremony began.
zh: 我刚一进大厅，仪式就开始了。

en: I found the boy fast asleep.
zh: 我发现那个男孩睡得很熟。

en: I found the boy sound asleep.
zh: 我发现那个男孩睡得正香。

en: When I went to look, I found the boy fast asleep.
zh: 我过去看的时候，发现那个男孩已经睡熟了。

en: There were a lot of empty seats the day I went.
zh: 我去的那天有很多空位。

en: There is nothing to prevent my going.
zh: 没有什么能阻止我去。

en: As for the scheme I had in my head, it was not a bad one in itself.
zh: 至于我脑子里那个计划，其实本身还不赖。

en: I was walking in the park, when I heard my name called.
zh: 我正在公园散步，突然听到有人叫我的名字。

en: It was yesterday that I broke the window by mistake.
zh: 我是昨天不小心打破窗户的。

en: There is one thing I look back on with regret.
zh: 有一件事我现在回想起来还挺遗憾的。

en: She had already gone to bed when I phoned her at 11:00 p.m.
zh: 我晚上11点给她打电话时，她已经睡了。

en: She had already gone to bed when I called her at 11 p.m.
zh: 我晚上11点打给她的时候，她已经睡下了。

en: It was not until I called that he came.
zh: 直到我叫他，他才过来。

en: He turned around when I called.
zh: 我一叫他，他就回过头来了。

en: While I was intent on improving my language skill, I came upon an English grammar book.
zh: 我正一心想提高语言能力，偶然发现了一本英语语法书。

en: I mean what I say.
zh: 我说话是认真的。

en: What I'm saying is quite true.
zh: 我说的都是真的。

en: Please bear in mind what I said.
zh: 请记住我说过的话。

en: You should keep in mind what I told you.
zh: 你得记住我跟你说的话。

en: Do as I tell you.
zh: 照我说的做。

en: There can't be a girl who is waiting for me to appear.
zh: 不可能有女孩在等着我出现。

en: My cousin had been sick in bed for a week when I visited him.
zh: 我去看我表哥的时候，他已经病了一周了。

en: I found nothing but a pair of scissors.
zh: 我除了发现一把剪刀，别的什么也没找到。

en: Everything that I saw was completely different from what I had expected.
zh: 我看到的一切都和我预想的完全不同。

en: It's a house just like that I have seen.
zh: 这房子和我之前见过的一模一样。

en: No tongue can tell of the wonders I saw.
zh: 我见到的奇景简直没法用语言形容。

en: I was helped by my father to paint the kennel.
zh: 在爸爸的帮助下，我给狗窝刷了漆。

en: I owe it to my parents that I am so healthy.
zh: 我现在这么健康，全靠我爸妈。

en: When I visited Ken, he was studying.
zh: 我去找肯的时候，他正在学习呢。

en: I hoped that I would marry while my mother was still alive.
zh: 我希望能在我妈还在世的时候结婚。

en: I had hoped that my mother would live until I got married.
zh: 我原本希望我妈能活到看我结婚的时候。

en: You can trust that I will never break my promise.
zh: 放心吧，我绝对不会食言的。

en: There is no reason that I should give up my plan.
zh: 我没有理由放弃我的计划。

en: I will let you go home at once.
zh: 我这就让你回家。

en: I'll take over your duties.
zh: 我来接手你的工作。

en: The girl I told you about lives in Kyoto.
zh: 我跟你提过的那个女孩住在京都。

en: The girl about whom I told you lives here.
zh: 我跟你说的那个女孩住在这里。

en: The girl I told you about lives here.
zh: 我跟你说的那个女孩住在这儿。

en: Stand upright when I'm talking to you.
zh: 我跟你说话的时候，给我站直了。

en: If I were you, I wouldn't do such a thing.
zh: 我要是你，我就不会做那种事。

en: I wish I were as young as you.
zh: 我真希望我能像你这么年轻。

en: He told me that if he were I, he would not do so.
zh: 他跟我说，如果他是我的话，他就不会那么做。

en: Were I you, I would study harder.
zh: 我要是你，我就更努力学习了。

en: If I were you, I'd study harder.
zh: 我要是你，我就更努力点学了。

en: Were I you, I would not do such a rude thing.
zh: 我要是你，绝对不会做那么粗鲁的事。

en: If I were you, I wouldn't do such a rude thing.
zh: 如果我是你，我才不会那么没礼貌。

en: Were I you, I would start at once.
zh: 我要是你，我这就出发。

en: The plane had already taken off when I reached the airport.
zh: 我到机场的时候，飞机已经起飞了。

en: He can no more swim than I can fly.
zh: 他不会游泳，就像我不会飞一样。

en: To my surprise, her reply was flatly negative.
zh: 让我没想到的是，她一口回绝了。

en: To my shock, he killed himself by taking poison.
zh: 让我震惊的是，他竟然服毒自杀了。

en: He failed in my having been surprised at the examination.
zh: 让我大吃一惊的是，他竟然考试没及格。

en: To my surprise, he didn't know how to use the dictionary.
zh: 让我惊讶的是，他竟然不会查字典。

en: One third of the friends I grew up with are dead.
zh: 跟我一起长大的朋友里，有三分之一已经不在了。

en: She was in charge of the office while I was away on a trip to Kyoto for a week.
zh: 我去京都那一周，办公室由她负责。

en: I hurried, not because it was getting dark, but because I was hungry.
zh: 我紧赶慢赶，不是因为天要黑了，而是因为我饿了。

en: The reason for my absence is that I was ill.
zh: 我没来是因为我生病了。

en: It is a great honor for me to have been elected chairman.
zh: 能当选主席是我的荣幸。

en: When I got up, it was snowing outside.
zh: 我起床的时候，外面正下着雪呢。

en: What I like is her way of talking.
zh: 我喜欢她说话的样子。

en: It began to rain before I got home.
zh: 我还没到家就开始下雨了。

en: When I came home, my sister was playing the guitar.
zh: 我回家的时候，我妹正在弹吉他。

en: When I returned home, my brother had done his homework.
zh: 我回家的时候，我弟已经写完作业了。

en: My father was on the point of going out when I came home.
zh: 我到家的时候，我爸正要出门。

en: When I came home, she was watching TV.
zh: 我回家的时候，她正在看电视。

en: When I returned home, my brother was doing his homework.
zh: 我回家的时候，我弟正在写作业。

en: My sisters were cooking when I came home.
zh: 我回家的时候，我姐妹们正在做饭。

en: When I came home, Tom was studying.
zh: 我回家的时候，汤姆正在学习。

en: Ken was reading when I came home.
zh: 我回家的时候，肯正在看书。

en: My parents had already eaten by the time I got home.
zh: 我到家的时候，我爸妈已经吃过饭了。

en: Be sure to get this finished by the time I come back.
zh: 等我回来的时候，你一定要把这个弄完。

en: If you get to my house before I do, help yourself to a drink.
zh: 如果你比我先到家，想喝什么就自便。

en: Please stay here till I get back.
zh: 请在这儿等我回来。

en: My mother had cooked supper when I got home.
zh: 我到家的时候，我妈已经做好晚饭了。

en: My mother had been cooking supper for two hours when I got home.
zh: 我到家的时候，我妈已经做了两个小时晚饭了。

en: My father was already at home when I came back.
zh: 我回来的时候，我爸已经在家了。

en: I will get the machine running.
zh: 我会让机器运转起来的。

en: While I was cleaning out my desk, I came across this old picture.
zh: 我收拾书桌的时候，翻到了这张旧照片。

en: She says something every time I turn around.
zh: 每次我一转身，她都要说点什么。

en: It's a miracle that I've got over cancer.
zh: 我能挺过癌症简直是个奇迹。

en: It is not the car but the users that I am concerned about.
zh: 我担心的不是车，而是用的人。

en: I made a mistake.
zh: 我弄错了。

en: I was wrong.
zh: 我错了。

en: I've made a mistake.
zh: 我犯了个错。

en: Unless I am mistaken, I've seen that man before.
zh: 除非我记错了，不然我以前见过那个人。

en: I'll show you that I am right.
zh: 我会证明我是对的。

en: I found out that the woman I thought was a nurse was actually a doctor.
zh: 我发现那个我以为是护士的女人，其实是个医生。

en: I learned that woman I thought was a nurse is, in fact, a doctor.
zh: 我才知道那个我以为是护士的女人其实是个医生。

en: I now understand that the woman I thought was a nurse is a doctor.
zh: 我现在明白了，那个我以为是护士的女人其实是医生。

en: I'm not able to make clear how I am feeling.
zh: 我说不清楚我现在是什么感觉。

en: I had hardly reached the school when the bell rang.
zh: 我刚到学校，铃就响了。

en: The bell had already rung when I got to school.
zh: 我到学校的时候，铃已经响过了。

en: It was because of the accident that I was late for school.
zh: 就是因为那场事故我上学才迟到的。

en: To the best of my memory, he always smoked a pipe.
zh: 在我的记忆里，他总是抽烟斗。

en: Will you look after my dog while I'm out?
zh: 我出去的时候，你能帮我照看下我的狗吗？

en: He came when I was out.
zh: 我出去的时候他正好来了。

en: Were I a foreigner, I could not eat raw fish.
zh: 要是我个外国人，我就吃不下生鱼。

en: If I were a foreigner, I probably couldn't eat raw fish.
zh: 如果我是外国人，我可能吃不下生鱼片。

en: If I were a foreigner, I probably wouldn't be able to eat raw fish.
zh: 如果我是外国人的话，我大概没法吃生鱼片。

en: He will look after the cats for me while I'm abroad.
zh: 我出国的时候，他会帮我照顾猫。

en: Were you going to the railway station when I saw you?
zh: 我看见你那会儿，你是要去火车站吗？

en: Were you going to the train station when I saw you?
zh: 我见到你时，你是不是要去火车站？

en: It is her that I want to meet.
zh: 我想见的人就是她。

en: You are the very man I want to see.
zh: 你就是我要找的那个人。

en: What I can't bear is the sound of chalk squeaking on a chalkboard.
zh: 我最受不了粉笔划黑板的声音。

en: I will take care of the flowers.
zh: 我会照顾好这些花的。

en: I sustain my family.
zh: 我养活全家。

en: I am supporting my family.
zh: 我正在养家糊口。

en: It will be a long time before I can buy a house.
zh: 要过很久我才能买得起房。

en: Please help me clean the house.
zh: 请帮我打扫一下屋子。

en: I had scarcely left home when it began to rain.
zh: 我刚出门就下雨了。

en: Hardly had I left home when it began to rain.
zh: 我刚离开家，天就开始下雨了。

en: No sooner had I left the house than it started to rain.
zh: 我前脚刚迈出家门，后脚就开始下雨了。

en: I was leaving home, when it started to rain.
zh: 我正要出门，天就开始下雨了。

en: I was about to leave my house when she rang me up.
zh: 我正准备出门，她就给我打电话了。

en: I was about to leave my house when she called.
zh: 我正要出门的时候，她来电话了。

en: When I was about to leave my house, I got a phone call from her.
zh: 就在我正要出门的时候，接到了她的电话。

en: It began to rain five minutes after I left home.
zh: 我离家五分钟后就开始下雨了。

en: It was quite dark when I got home.
zh: 我到家的时候，天已经很黑了。

en: Mother had prepared supper when I got home.
zh: 我到家的时候，妈妈已经做好晚饭了。

en: She was watching TV when I came home.
zh: 我回家的时候，她正在看电视。

en: He wasn't sleeping when I came home.
zh: 我回家的时候，他还没睡呢。

en: When I came home, he was cooking dinner.
zh: 我回家的时候，他在做饭。

en: As soon as I got home, my sister went out.
zh: 我一到家，我妹就出门了。

en: When I'm home and I'm going to the corner drugstore to pick up some shampoo, why do you always tell me to be careful how I cross the street?
zh: 我在家想去街角药店买瓶洗发水，你干嘛总叫我过马路小心点？

en: You know what I mean.
zh: 你知道我什么意思。

en: She has no idea what I intend to do.
zh: 她根本不知道我打算干什么。

en: They have no idea what I intend to do.
zh: 他们根本不知道我打算干什么。

en: No matter what I did, no one paid any attention to me.
zh: 不管我做什么，都没人理我。

en: Can't you guess what I'm doing?
zh: 你猜不到我在干嘛吗？

en: This is the last time I'll ask you to do anything for me.
zh: 这是我最后一次求你帮我做事了。

en: If I want to do anything, you want me to do something else.
zh: 我想干点啥，你总想让我干别的。

en: This is the last time I'll ask you to do anything.
zh: 这是我最后一次叫你做事了。

en: Are you suggesting that I'm a coward?
zh: 你是说我是个胆小鬼吗？

en: I wish I were a prince.
zh: 我真希望我是个王子。

en: It took me two hours to get to Yokohama.
zh: 我花了两个小时才到横滨。

en: It took me two hours to reach Yokohama.
zh: 去横滨花了我两个小时。

en: Do you have to make a speech?
zh: 你非得演讲吗？

en: Do I have to make a speech?
zh: 我必须得演讲吗？

en: Without your help, he would fail.
zh: 要是没有你的帮助，他肯定会失败。

en: The train left before I arrived at the station.
zh: 我还没到车站，火车就开了。

en: I had no sooner reached the station than the train started.
zh: 我刚到车站，火车就出发了。

en: The train was on the point of leaving when I got to the station.
zh: 我到车站的时候，火车正要开。

en: The train was about to leave when I arrived at the station.
zh: 我到车站的时候，火车快要开了。

en: When I arrived at the station, the train had already left.
zh: 我到车站的时候，火车已经开了。

en: As I reached the station, the express was just drawing in.
zh: 我刚到车站，快车正好进站。

en: The train had already left when I got to the station.
zh: 我到车站时，火车已经开走了。

en: The train had already left when I arrived at the station.
zh: 我到车站的时候，火车已经走了。

en: My meeting her at the station was a pure accident.
zh: 我在车站碰到她纯属偶然。

en: While I was waiting for the rain to stop, he kindly gave me a lift.
zh: 我等雨停的时候，他好心送了我一程。

en: The people with whom I work are all very kind.
zh: 跟我一起工作的那些人都非常友好。

en: The people I work with are all very kind.
zh: 跟我共事的那些人人都挺好的。

en: I had been waiting an hour when he appeared.
zh: 他出现的时候，我都等了一个小时了。

en: If only I were a doctor.
zh: 我要是医生就好了。

en: There are many words with meanings I don't know.
zh: 有很多词的意思我都不认识。

en: You can no more expect me to change my opinion than expect the sun to rise in the west.
zh: 想让我改变主意，除非太阳从西边出来。

en: I ought to ask, oughtn't I?
zh: 我该问一下，不是吗？

en: I should ask, shouldn't I?
zh: 我应该问问，对吧？

en: What has become of my old house where I used to live?
zh: 我以前住的老房子现在怎么样了？

en: The reason why I got a bad grade is that I did not study.
zh: 我成绩不好是因为我没好好学习。

en: No blame attaches to me.
zh: 这事儿不怪我。

en: I am to blame.
zh: 是我的错。

en: The boy I love doesn't love me.
zh: 我喜欢的那个男孩不喜欢我。

en: It was not by plane, but by ship, that I went to London.
zh: 我去伦敦不是坐飞机，而是坐船。

en: It was on the morning of February the ninth that I arrived in London.
zh: 我是2月9号早晨到伦敦的。

en: I threw the rope and she caught hold of it.
zh: 我把绳子扔过去，她抓住了。

en: I will warn him.
zh: 我会警告他的。

en: Please tell John that I called.
zh: 请告诉约翰我给他打过电话了。

en: I wish you to relieve me of my anxiety.
zh: 我希望你别再让我担心了。

en: Let go of me!
zh: 放开我！

en: Will you take your hand off me?
zh: 能把你的手拿开吗？

en: In my eyes, he is wrong.
zh: 在我眼里，他错了。

en: In my point of view, a car does more harm than good.
zh: 在我看来，买车弊大于利。

en: The girl that I know very well has already left for Tokyo.
zh: 那个我很熟的女孩已经去东京了。

en: It makes no difference whether you want to do it or not.
zh: 你想不想做都一样。

en: Bring the painting closer so that I may see it better.
zh: 把画拿近点，我好能看得清楚些。

en: I should ask him if I were you.
zh: 我要是你，我就该去问他。

en: I would ask him if I were you.
zh: 我要是你的话，我就会去问他。

en: If I were you, I'd ask him.
zh: 我要是你，我就去问他。

en: I owe it to my doctor that I am still alive.
zh: 我能活到现在多亏了我的医生。

en: When I was about to leave my house, I got a telephone call from her.
zh: 我正要出门的时候，接到了她的电话。

en: I was just going to express an opinion, when he cut in.
zh: 我正想说点看法，他就插话了。

en: To my relief he recovered from his illness.
zh: 让我欣慰的是，他的病好了。

en: When I was staying in Boston, I made her acquaintance.
zh: 我在波士顿住的时候认识了她。

en: This isn't exactly what I wanted.
zh: 这不完全是我想要的。

en: It is not money but time that I want.
zh: 我想要的不是钱，而是时间。

en: It is not tea but coffee that I want.
zh: 我要的不是茶，是咖啡。

en: What I want isn't tea, but coffee.
zh: 我想要的不是茶，而是咖啡。

en: I'd like coffee rather than tea, please.
zh: 我想喝咖啡，不喝茶，谢谢。

en: I played football and my sister played tennis.
zh: 我踢足球，我妹妹打网球。

en: The taxi I took was very old and small.
zh: 我打的那辆出租车又破又小。

en: Do you think it strange that I should live alone?
zh: 你觉得我一个人住很奇怪吗？

en: It is difficult for me to play the piano.
zh: 弹钢琴对我来说挺难的。

en: It was this fountain pen that I bought in Paris.
zh: 这支钢笔就是我在巴黎买的那支。

en: It was in Tokyo that I first met her father.
zh: 我是在东京第一次见到她父亲的。

en: It was when I was thirteen that I fell in love with a girl for the first time.
zh: 我是在十三岁那年第一次爱上一个女孩的。

en: It is no business of yours what tie I wear.
zh: 我戴什么领带不关你的事。

en: It has been just a week since I arrived in New York.
zh: 我到纽约刚好一个星期。

en: Let me say what I will, he doesn't mind me.
zh: 不管我怎么说，他都不理我。

en: This is the same watch that I lost.
zh: 这就是我丢的那块表。

en: You will never realize what I went through.
zh: 你永远体会不到我经历了什么。

en: Note how I do it.
zh: 看好了我是怎么做的。

en: You don't understand how worried I was about you.
zh: 你不知道我当时有多担心你。

en: What interests me greatly is astronomy.
zh: 我最感兴趣的是天文学。

en: Words can not convey how glad I am.
zh: 言语无法表达我有多高兴。

en: He was angry because I wouldn't give him any help.
zh: 他因为我不肯帮他而生气了。

en: Inform your father of my arrival.
zh: 告诉你爸爸我到了。

en: I'll read you the poem I wrote just now.
zh: 我把我刚才写的诗读给你听。

en: I was just about to go out shopping when you telephoned.
zh: 我正准备出去买东西，你就打电话来了。

en: I was about to go to bed when the phone rang.
zh: 我正要睡觉，电话就响了。

en: I'll fix it up all right.
zh: 我会把它搞定的。

en: It happened that she was out when I called.
zh: 我打电话的时候，她刚好不在。

en: To my great delight, he won the first prize.
zh: 让我非常高兴的是，他拿了一等奖。

en: At such times, I think of my family, not my friends.
zh: 在那样的时刻，我想的是家人，不是朋友。

en: I will endorse it.
zh: 我会支持的。

en: I see no reason why I shouldn't put it into practice.
zh: 我没理由不把它付诸实践。

en: Nothing would please him but I must do it myself.
zh: 只有我亲自做，他才会满意。

en: It was a mere chance that I found it.
zh: 我只是碰巧找到了它。

en: He isn't any more capable of it than I am.
zh: 他并不比我更有本事。

en: There is no reason why I shouldn't do it.
zh: 我没理由不去做。

en: Don't expect me to do it for you. It's your baby.
zh: 别指望我替你做，那是你自己的事。

en: As I read through the letters, I realized that the Pope was the true culprit.
zh: 我读完这些信才发现，教皇才是真正的罪魁祸首。

en: That is as much as I dare spend on it.
zh: 我最多也就敢在那上面花这么多钱了。

en: I only found out about it purely by accident.
zh: 我完全是出于偶然才发现这件事的。

en: It is impossible for me to solve the problem.
zh: 我根本解决不了这个问题。

en: It'll take me a long time to finish reading that book.
zh: 我得花好长时间才能看完那本书。

en: He left the room on my entering it.
zh: 我一进屋，他就出去了。

en: He left the room as soon as I entered it.
zh: 我一进门，他就出去了。

en: I went into the room, where I found the children sitting on the sofa.
zh: 我走进屋，发现孩子们正坐在沙发上。

en: It was only yesterday that I heard the news.
zh: 我昨天才听说那个消息。

en: Mrs. White broke into tears when I told her the news.
zh: 我告诉怀特太太那个消息时，她一下子哭了出来。

en: Must I open the window?
zh: 我必须开窗户吗？

en: Do I have to open the window?
zh: 我得把窗户打开吗？

en: I'll take the responsibility on my shoulders.
zh: 这责任我来担。

en: It stands to reason that I should decline the offer.
zh: 按理说，我应该拒绝。

en: I paid 2,000 yen for the parcel to be sent by air.
zh: 我花了2000日元寄这个航空包裹。

en: It is easy for me to answer the question.
zh: 这个问题对我来说很容易回答。

en: It is impossible for me to answer the question.
zh: 这个问题我没法回答。

en: I will account for the incident.
zh: 我会交代一下这件事的。

en: I'll explain the incident.
zh: 我会解释一下这件事。

en: Let me tell you about the case.
zh: 我来跟你说说这个案子吧。

en: It will take me no less than 10 hours to prepare for the exam.
zh: 准备考试至少要花我十个小时。

en: Just picture to yourself the horror with which I saw the scene.
zh: 想象一下，我看到那一幕时有多恐怖。

en: I left the firm, because I wanted to be on my own.
zh: 我辞职了，因为我想自己单干。

en: The reason I could not attend the meeting was that I had a severe headache.
zh: 我没去参加会议是因为我头疼得厉害。

en: Is it necessary for me to attend the party?
zh: 我有必要参加那个聚会吗？

en: I had scarcely entered the class before the students started asking questions.
zh: 我刚进教室，学生们就开始问问题了。

en: As soon as I entered the class, the students started asking questions.
zh: 我一进教室，学生们就开始问问题。

en: No sooner had I got there than they started.
zh: 我刚到那儿，他们就开始了。

en: The dance had already started when I got there.
zh: 我到那儿的时候，舞会已经开始了。

en: There is no reason why I should go there.
zh: 我没理由非得去那儿。

en: They were about to leave when I arrived there.
zh: 我到那儿的时候，他们正要走。

en: It was quite dark when I got there.
zh: 我到那儿的时候天已经很黑了。

en: When I got there, the house was on fire.
zh: 我到那儿的时候，房子正着火呢。

en: Do I need to go there?
zh: 我需要去那儿吗？

en: Is there any need for me to go there?
zh: 我有必要去那儿吗？

en: Hang on till I get to you.
zh: 等我到了你那儿再说。

en: Nobody was conscious of my presence there.
zh: 没人注意到我在那儿。

en: It was a pure accident that I met him there.
zh: 在那儿碰到他纯属巧合。

en: No sooner had I done so than it began to rain.
zh: 我刚一做完，天就开始下雨了。

en: You will think it just that I should do so.
zh: 你会觉得我这么做是理所应当的。

en: It was easy for me to do so.
zh: 对我来说，那样做很容易。

en: He threw cold water on what I was doing.
zh: 他给我正在做的事泼了盆冷水。

en: The letter I've been waiting for has arrived at last.
zh: 我一直在等的信终于到了。

en: Will you help me pack up my suitcase?
zh: 能帮我收拾一下行李箱吗？

en: Will you help me pack my suitcase?
zh: 能帮我整理一下行李吗？

en: While I was talking on the telephone with John, the operator cut in.
zh: 我正跟约翰通电话呢，接线员插进来了。

en: The phone rang while I was taking a shower.
zh: 我正洗澡呢，电话响了。

en: I'll get in touch with Jim and ask him to come over.
zh: 我会联系吉姆，让他过来。

en: I wish I could go to the concert.
zh: 真希望能去那场演唱会。

en: I'll clear these dishes away.
zh: 我把这些碗收一下。

en: I owe it entirely to you that I have succeeded thus far.
zh: 我能有今天的成就全靠你。

en: Listen carefully to what I am going to tell you.
zh: 听好我要跟你说的话。

en: Note down what I'm going to say.
zh: 记一下我要说的话。

en: It is difficult for me to understand this question.
zh: 这个问题对我来说很难理解。

en: It took me three days to read this book.
zh: 我花了三天才看完这本书。

en: It took me about an hour to read this book through.
zh: 我花了大约一小时才把这本书看完。

en: I told this secret to you alone.
zh: 这个秘密我只跟你一个人说过。

en: After I sign these release papers, you'll be on your way.
zh: 我签完这些释放文件，你就可以走了。

en: It was in London that I last saw her.
zh: 我最后一次见她是在伦敦。

en: It is more than five years since I last saw him.
zh: 上次见他已经是五年多前的事了。

en: It's been more than five years since I last saw him.
zh: 我已经五年多没见过他了。

en: The watch I lost the other day was new.
zh: 我前几天丢的那块表是新的。

en: It has been twenty years since I saw you last.
zh: 咱们上次见面已经是二十年前了。

en: I take full responsibility for the action.
zh: 我对这次行动负全责。

en: I like this picture, not because it is a masterpiece, but because it has charm.
zh: 我喜欢这幅画，不是因为它是什么名作，而是因为它很有魅力。

en: I like this picture, not just because it is famous, but because it really is a masterpiece.
zh: 我喜欢这幅画，不只是因为它有名，而是因为它确实是杰作。

en: More than five years have passed since I came to live in this house.
zh: 我住进这房子已经五年多了。

en: I'll carry this case to your place.
zh: 我帮你把这个箱子提到你那儿吧。

en: Can you help me wash these dishes?
zh: 能帮我洗下碗吗？

en: I owe it entirely to him that I have thus far succeeded.
zh: 我到现在能成功全靠他。

en: It is two years since I came here.
zh: 我来这儿已经两年了。

en: It's been two years since I came here.
zh: 我到这儿都已经两年了。

en: It has been ten years since I came here.
zh: 我来这儿已经十年了。

en: Ten years have passed since I came here.
zh: 我来这儿都已经十年了。

en: It's because I was asked to come that I'm here.
zh: 我是因为被请过来才在这儿的。

en: It's been three years since I moved here.
zh: 我搬到这儿已经三年了。

en: The fact that I'm here proves that I'm innocent.
zh: 我出现在这儿就证明我是清白的。

en: Please wait till I have finished my coffee.
zh: 请等我喝完咖啡。

en: I owe it to him that I can earn a good salary.
zh: 我能拿这么高的工资全靠他。

en: To my disappointment I found that she wasn't honest.
zh: 让我失望的是，我发现她并不诚实。

en: I had scarcely opened the cage when the canary flew out.
zh: 我刚打开笼子，金丝雀就飞走了。

en: It was yesterday morning that I saw Mr. Carter.
zh: 我是昨天早上见到卡特先生的。

en: My name is Edgar Degas.
zh: 我叫埃德加·德加。

en: I am Edgar Degas.
zh: 我是埃德加·德加。

en: I owe what I am to my father.
zh: 我能有今天全靠我父亲。

en: Should anything happen in my absence, ask him for help.
zh: 要是我不在的时候出了什么事，就找他帮忙。

en: He asked me when I was going to buy a new car.
zh: 他问我打算什么时候买新车。

en: When have I told a lie?
zh: 我什么时候撒过谎？

en: He never hears what I'm trying to say.
zh: 他从来不听我要说什么。

en: You never listen, no matter how many times I tell you.
zh: 不管我说多少遍，你从来都不听。

en: That's exactly my point.
zh: 我正是这个意思。

en: I'm sorry I didn't make myself clear.
zh: 抱歉，我没说清楚。

en: There is no reason for me to apologize.
zh: 我没理由道歉。

en: Suppose I had gone to America.
zh: 假设我去了美国。

en: It is difficult for me to solve that problem.
zh: 那个问题对我来说很难解决。

en: I'll look after that child.
zh: 我会照顾那个孩子的。

en: Please don't get angry if I criticize.
zh: 如果我提意见，请别生气。

en: I would act differently in your place.
zh: 如果我是你，我会有不同的做法。

en: Were I in your position, I would quit.
zh: 如果我是你，我就不干了。

en: I will go there in place of you.
zh: 我会替你去那儿。

en: I'll act as a guide for you.
zh: 我来给你当导游。

en: Do as I ask you or I won't answer for the result.
zh: 按我要求的做，不然出什么事我不负责。

en: I will pay the money to you.
zh: 我会把钱付给你的。

en: I'll do everything for you, so you have only to wait here.
zh: 我会帮你把事都办好，你只要在这儿等着就行。

en: If I pay you a dollar, we'll be even.
zh: 我再给你一块钱，咱俩就两清了。

en: Were I you, I wouldn't refuse her offer.
zh: 如果我是你，我就不会拒绝她的提议。

en: It is next to impossible for me to go with you.
zh: 我几乎不可能跟你一起去。

en: If I were you, I would do the same.
zh: 如果我是你，我也会这么做。

en: I'd retain that old hat if I were you.
zh: 我要是你，我就留着那顶旧帽子。

en: If I were you, I wouldn't live with him.
zh: 如果我是你，我就不跟他住在一起。

en: When I was a student at MIT I used to eat at a certain restaurant in Boston.
zh: 我在麻省理工上学那会儿，常去波士顿的一家餐厅吃饭。

en: If I were eighty and she were still alive, I would be getting the same admonition.
zh: 就算我八十了，如果她还在世，我还是会听她同样的唠叨。

en: It appears my mail on January 10 did not reach you.
zh: 看来我1月10号发的那封信你没收到。

en: When I reach retirement age in 1998, I will have worked for the college for thirty years.
zh: 到1998年我退休时，我就在这所学院工作满三十年了。

en: Ten years have passed since I came to Tokyo at the age of eighteen.
zh: 从我十八岁来东京到现在已经十年了。

en: Wait till I count to ten.
zh: 等我数到十。

en: This is the one I meant when I said, 'A man who comes after me has surpassed me because he was before me.'
zh: 这就是我之前说的那个人：‘他走在我后面，却已经超过了我，因为他原本就在我前面。’

en: I hope I will have a chance to see you next time I'm in New York.
zh: 希望下次去纽约的时候有机会能见到你。

en: I hope that I will have a chance to see you next time I'm in New York.
zh: 希望下次我去纽约的时候能有机会见你。

en: John had cleaned the house when I came home.
zh: 我回到家时，约翰已经把房子打扫干净了。

en: Have any letters arrived for me?
zh: 有我的信吗？

en: Are there any letters for me?
zh: 有我的信吗？

en: I cooked dinner.
zh: 我做了晚饭。

en: I have some coupons I got last week.
zh: 我这儿有几张上周领的优惠券。

en: I do a lot of worrying.
zh: 我这人老爱瞎操心。

en: I really like Jiro Akagawa's novels.
zh: 我很喜欢赤川次郎的小说。

en: I'm on the road a lot, and my clients are complaining that they can never reach me.
zh: 我经常在外面跑，客户都抱怨总联系不上我。

en: I'm Nana. I'm Hideki Yamauchi's daughter.
zh: 我是奈奈，山内秀树的女儿。

en: I am in a spot.
zh: 我现在处境有点难办。

en: I am not going to join the year-end party tonight.
zh: 今晚的年会我不去了。

en: I feel so happy today.
zh: 我今天太开心了。

en: This is the first time I've worked as a coordinator, so I may not have the hang of it yet.
zh: 这是我第一次当协调员，可能还没摸着门道。

en: I feel at ease.
zh: 我觉得挺自在的。

en: I'm so mad I want to scream and break everything!
zh: 我气得想大叫，想砸碎所有东西！

en: I am as happy as a clam.
zh: 我快活得不得了。

en: I realized then that this awful cellar was the only place that could save our lives.
zh: 我那时才意识到，这个破地窖是唯一能救我们命的地方。

en: Birth is much, breeding is more.
zh: 出生固然重要，教养更重要。

en: I'm going with Ken. He is cool, gentle and smart. What's more, he is single!
zh: 我要跟肯在一起。他帅气、温柔又聪明，而且他还是单身！

en: Do your very best.
zh: 尽你最大的努力。

en: The population is dying off.
zh: 人口正在不断减少。

en: Your gift was like discovery of an oasis in the midst of a desert.
zh: 你的礼物就像沙漠中的绿洲一样。

en: The postmortem showed that she had been strangled.
zh: 尸检显示她是被人勒死的。

en: The body had burned beyond recognition.
zh: 尸体已经被烧得面目全非了。

en: The drowned body has not been recovered.
zh: 溺水者的尸体还没有找回来。

en: Dead men tell no tales.
zh: 死人是不会说话的。

en: Hisao's face was as pale as that of a corpse.
zh: 久夫的脸色像死尸一样惨白。

en: Death is seeking for his prey.
zh: 死神正在寻找猎物。

en: Casualties are said to total up to 1,000.
zh: 据说伤亡人数总计达到了一千人。

en: Speak well of the dead.
zh: 对死者要说好话。

en: After his death, his paintings were hung in the museum.
zh: 他去世后，他的画被挂在了博物馆里。

en: Some people believe in eternal life after death.
zh: 有些人相信死后可以永生。

en: The death penalty has been done away with in many states in the USA.
zh: 美国很多州都已经废除死刑了。

en: The death penalty should be abolished.
zh: 死刑应该被废除。

en: We must abolish the death penalty.
zh: 我们必须废除死刑。

en: The death penalty was done away with last year.
zh: 去年死刑被废除了。

en: The cause of death was a heart attack.
zh: 死因是心脏病发作。

en: He's dead?
zh: 他死了？

en: I wish I was dead.
zh: 我真想死。

en: I wish I were dead.
zh: 我真想死。

en: The antiques my father left when he died turned out to be nothing but worthless junk.
zh: 我父亲去世时留下的那些古董，结果全是不值钱的破烂。

en: You mustn't speak ill of the dead.
zh: 你不能说死人的坏话。

en: He wished himself dead.
zh: 他想一死了之。

en: You can't take it with you when you die.
zh: 生不带来，死不带去。

en: You're not the one who died.
zh: 死的又不是你。

en: One who longs for death is miserable, but more miserable is he who fears it.
zh: 渴望死亡的人很可悲，但畏惧死亡的人更可悲。

en: Nothing can happen more beautiful than death.
zh: 没有什么比死亡更美好的了。

en: Death is certain to come to everybody.
zh: 每个人都难逃一死。

en: Death is certain to all, all shall die.
zh: 所有人都会死。

en: Death is the antithesis of life.
zh: 死亡是生命的对立面。

en: Death is the ugly fact which Nature has to hide and she hides it well.
zh: 死亡是大自然必须掩盖的丑恶事实，而且它掩盖得很好。

en: Death is the great leveler.
zh: 死亡面前人人平等。

en: Death is often compared to sleep.
zh: 死亡常被比作睡眠。

en: Death comes to all men.
zh: 每个人最终都会面临死亡。

en: Death is preferable to dishonor.
zh: 宁死不辱。

en: Is death the only release?
zh: 难道死是唯一的解脱吗？

en: Before he died, he was almost blind.
zh: 他去世前眼睛快瞎了。

en: Do or die.
zh: 拼了。

en: I am ready for death.
zh: 我已经准备好面对死亡了。

en: Nothing remains but to die.
zh: 除了等死，没别的路了。

en: There's one thing I shall never understand till my dying day.
zh: 有件事我到死都不会明白。

en: I'll love you for the rest of my days.
zh: 我余生都会爱你。

en: I'll love you until I die.
zh: 我会爱你到死。

en: I'll love you for the rest of my life.
zh: 我会爱你一辈子。

en: I'm dying to see you.
zh: 我想死你了。

en: I am afraid of dying.
zh: 我怕死。

en: I'm afraid of dying.
zh: 我怕死。

en: Never say die.
zh: 别灰心。

en: Would it hurt to die?
zh: 死的时候会疼吗？

en: It requires more courage to suffer than to die.
zh: 活着受苦比一死了之更需要勇气。

en: I wish myself dead.
zh: 我恨不得去死。

en: Death ends man's finite existence.
zh: 死亡终结了人有限的一生。

en: The thought flashed through her mind that she was going to die.
zh: 她脑子里闪过一个念头：她要死了。

en: Please don't die!
zh: 求求你别死！

en: Don't die.
zh: 别死。

en: To love and to cherish, till death do us part.
zh: 相亲相爱，直到死亡将我们分开。

en: "Don't stop, Tony," said Linda.
zh: “别停，托尼，”琳达说。

en: She would go out in the heavy rain, though I tried to stop her.
zh: 尽管我拦着她，她还是冒着大雨出去了。

en: A stop sign in Japan has 3 sides, whereas a stop sign in the U.S. has 8 sides.
zh: 日本的停车标志是三角形的，而美国的停车标志是八角形的。

en: Why don't we stop arguing over these piddling matters and get to the issues at hand?
zh: 别为这些鸡毛蒜皮的小事吵了，咱们说正事吧。

en: I'm troubled by split ends.
zh: 我头发开叉，挺让人心烦的。

en: Don't break off the branch.
zh: 别把树枝折断了。

en: The bough bent under the weight of the snow.
zh: 树枝被雪压弯了。

en: The branches gave but did not break.
zh: 树枝弯了，但没断。

en: The branches were bowed down with oranges.
zh: 树上挂满了橘子，树枝都压弯了。

en: Every successful repetition spoke favorably for the quality of the first test.
zh: 每次重复实验的成功都说明第一次测试的质量很过关。

en: Institutions, however noble their missions, have failed to replace the family.
zh: 无论机构的使命多么崇高，都无法取代家庭。

en: Also, please inform us of your terms of payment.
zh: 另外，请告知你们的付款条件。

en: Can I pay a credit card?
zh: 能刷卡吗？

en: Can I use a credit card for payment?
zh: 我可以用信用卡支付吗？

en: This is a friendly reminder about an overdue invoice.
zh: 友情提醒一下，有一笔账单逾期了。

en: I have run into a problem that is causing the delay of my payment.
zh: 我遇到点麻烦，导致付款延迟了。

en: You need to open an account at a bank to receive the payment.
zh: 你得去银行开个户才能收到这笔钱。

en: I'd like to pay the check, please.
zh: 服务员，买单。

en: This is all on me.
zh: 全算我的。

en: I need to find a better job on the double to pay my bills.
zh: 我得赶紧找份更好的工作来付账单。

en: Solvency is entirely a matter of temperament and not of income.
zh: 能不能还得起钱完全看性格，跟赚多少没关系。

en: The manager put up a notice about the extra holiday.
zh: 经理贴了个关于额外假期的通知。

en: The manager was unnecessarily rough on him.
zh: 经理对他态度太差了，其实没必要那样。

en: The manager threatened him with dismissal.
zh: 经理威胁要开除他。

en: The manager put forward a new proposal.
zh: 经理提出了一个新方案。

en: The manager made an apology for having been out.
zh: 经理为自己当时不在场道了歉。

en: The manager stood at the door.
zh: 经理站在门口。

en: The manager approved our plan.
zh: 经理批准了我们的计划。

en: The manager opened the door and identified himself.
zh: 经理开了门并表明了身份。

en: The manager advanced him two weeks' wages.
zh: 经理预支了他两周的工资。

en: The manager ordered all the rooms to be swept clean as soon as possible.
zh: 经理要求尽快把所有房间打扫干净。

en: He acted behind the manager's back.
zh: 他背着经理搞小动作。

en: I am going to complain to the manager.
zh: 我要去经理那儿投诉。

en: I want to see the manager.
zh: 我想见下经理。

en: She handles the business when the manager is away.
zh: 经理不在的时候，由她负责打理生意。

en: The manager was out, so I left a message with his secretary.
zh: 经理不在，所以我给他的秘书留了言。

en: The ruler was overthrown and banished from the country.
zh: 统治者被推翻并逐出了国境。

en: I'm going to complain to the manager.
zh: 我打算找经理投诉。

en: Where did he ever come up with the notion of opening a branch?
zh: 他是怎么想到要开分店的？

en: Our branches extend all over the country.
zh: 我们的分店遍布全国。

en: The expenditure totaled 200,000 yen.
zh: 总支出一共是20万日元。

en: Tom's acknowledgement that he stole the ring cleared the maid of suspicion.
zh: 汤姆承认戒指是他偷的，洗清了女佣的嫌疑。

en: Would you show me some rings?
zh: 能给我看看戒指吗？

en: The ring was not to be found anywhere.
zh: 到处都找不到那枚戒指。

en: It's best to make international calls person to person.
zh: 打国际长途最好打叫名电话。

en: Make it a person-to-person call, please.
zh: 请帮我接个人对人叫名电话。

en: The index advanced to 120.5, up 4% from the preceding month.
zh: 指数升至120.5，比上月增长了4%。

en: The index rose 4% from the preceding month.
zh: 指数比上个月上涨了4%。

en: The leaders were out of touch with the people.
zh: 领导们脱离了群众。

en: The leaders assembled in Paris for a meeting.
zh: 领导们在巴黎集会开会。

en: When their leader died, they placed his body in a large tomb.
zh: 他们的首领去世后，他们把他的遗体安葬在了一座大墓里。

en: Are there reserved seats?
zh: 有预留位吗？

en: The index rose to a seasonally adjusted 120.5.
zh: 经季节性因素调整后，指数升至120.5。

en: The leader dismissed the demonstrators in the park.
zh: 领导把公园里的示威人群给遣散了。

en: A conductor directs an orchestra.
zh: 指挥是负责指挥交响乐团的。

en: He has good credentials as a conductor.
zh: 作为指挥，他的资历挺不错的。

en: The conductor appeared on the stage.
zh: 指挥走上了舞台。

en: The commander exposed his men to gunfire.
zh: 指挥官让他的士兵们暴露在了敌方的炮火之下。

en: The commanding officer led his army into enemy territory.
zh: 指挥官带领军队进入了敌方领土。

en: He wouldn't even lift a finger.
zh: 他连手指头都懒得动一下。

en: I bleed easily when I am cut.
zh: 我身上一被划破就容易流血。

en: I just cut my finger.
zh: 我刚才不小心把手给割破了。

en: Don't cut your finger.
zh: 别割到手了。

en: Not only has eating with your fingers continued throughout the centuries, but some scholars believe that it may become popular again.
zh: 用手抓着吃饭不仅延续了几个世纪，有些学者还觉得这以后可能会再次流行起来。

en: Is using fingers uncivilized?
zh: 用手抓着吃饭是不文明的行为吗？

en: He stood with his finger in his mouth.
zh: 他站在那里，手指头含在嘴里。

en: They moved up and down the keys.
zh: 他们的手指在琴键上上下翻飞。

en: Yes, you can indicate everything you see.
zh: 没错，你看到的任何东西都可以指出来。

en: I got a burn on my finger.
zh: 我的手指烫伤了。

en: Thought is free.
zh: 思想是自由的。

en: Around the world thoughts shall fly in the twinkling of an eye.
zh: 一眨眼的功夫，想法就能传遍全世界。

en: An idea is expressed in terms of action.
zh: 想法是通过行动来体现的。

en: Freedom of thought is guaranteed by the constitution.
zh: 宪法保障公民的思想自由。

en: I couldn't help laughing out.
zh: 我忍不住笑出声来了。

en: I couldn't help laughing.
zh: 我忍不住笑了起来。

en: I laughed in spite of myself.
zh: 我不禁笑了起来。

en: I can't read your mind.
zh: 我又看不透你在想什么。

en: Saying what you think frankly is not a bad thing.
zh: 坦率地说出自己的想法并不是什么坏事。

en: There are many more people than I expected.
zh: 人比我预期的要多得多。

en: I could not catch as many fish as I had expected.
zh: 我没钓到预想中那么多鱼。

en: It is easier than I thought.
zh: 这比我想象的要容易。

en: I guessed right.
zh: 我猜对了。

en: She's an outspoken person.
zh: 她是个心直口快的人。

en: It's not even worth a thought.
zh: 这事儿根本不值得考虑。

en: I think he is a good man.
zh: 我觉得他人挺不错的。

en: Quick, let's get started on the project proposal while the idea is still fresh in our minds. There's no time like the present.
zh: 快，趁着现在灵感还在，咱们赶紧把项目方案写出来吧。择日不如撞日。

en: You can go however you like.
zh: 你想怎么去都行。

en: Have your own way.
zh: 随你便吧。

en: I'm trying to remember.
zh: 我在努力回忆呢。

en: My heart was in my boots when I thought of it.
zh: 一想到这事我就心灰意冷。

en: Remembering it depressed me.
zh: 想起这件事就让我感到很沮丧。

en: Barring anything unforeseen everything should turn all right.
zh: 如果没有什么意外的话，一切应该都会进展顺利。

en: What the heart thinks, the mouth speaks.
zh: 心里想什么，嘴上就说什么。

en: I'm really happy I ran into you.
zh: 真高兴能碰见你。

en: Your imagination is running away with you.
zh: 你也太能胡思乱想了。

en: To believe that an unexpected big fortune will come your way is to build a castle in Spain.
zh: 幻想着能发大财简直就是在白日做梦。

en: The accident destroyed all his hopes for success.
zh: 那场事故断送了他成功的希望。

en: We ran into each other at the airport.
zh: 我们在机场碰到了。

en: I don't recall.
zh: 我想不起来了。

en: Not all the candidates can pass the examination.
zh: 并不是所有候选人都能通过这次考试。

en: I worked hard to get into my preferred school.
zh: 为了考上心仪的学校，我非常努力。

en: Applicants are requested to apply in person.
zh: 申请人必须本人亲自前来办理。

en: It is provided that the applicants must be woman.
zh: 规定申请人必须是女性。

en: How long does it take to walk to the city hall?
zh: 走路去市政厅要多久？

en: How long does it take to walk to City Hall?
zh: 走路到市政厅要多长时间？

en: Can you tell me how to get to the city hall?
zh: 你能告诉我市政厅怎么走吗？

en: The city hall is in the center of the city.
zh: 市政厅在市中心。

en: The city hall is located at the center of the city.
zh: 市政厅位于市中心。

en: The city hall is just around the corner.
zh: 市政厅就在转角处。

en: The citizens staggered under the heavy bombing.
zh: 市民们在猛烈的轰炸下苦苦支撑。

en: I applied for a job as a lifeguard at the community pool.
zh: 我申请了社区游泳池救生员的工作。

en: All the citizens of the city have access to the city library.
zh: 全市市民都可以使用市图书馆。

en: No citizen should be deprived of his rights.
zh: 任何公民的权利都不应该被剥夺。

en: Citizens are the ultimate sovereigns.
zh: 公民才是最终的掌权者。

en: The citizens demonstrated to protest against the new project.
zh: 市民们游行抗议那个新项目。

en: I'd like a map of the city.
zh: 我想要一张城市地图。

en: I'd like a city map.
zh: 我想要一份城市地图。

en: Are there any tours of the city?
zh: 有市内的观光团吗？

en: The number of cars running in the city has increased.
zh: 城里的车变多了。

en: Where's the bus for the city?
zh: 去市区的公交车在哪儿？

en: I plan to stay in the city.
zh: 我打算留在城里。

en: There is a plan to restrict the use of cars in the city center.
zh: 有个计划要限制在市中心开车。

en: The city took the initiative in the pollution suit.
zh: 市政府在污染诉讼中采取了主动。

en: The city government once thought of doing away with that rule.
zh: 市政府曾考虑过废除那项规定。

en: Voters cast their ballots for mayor every four years.
zh: 选民每四年选一次市长。

en: The mayor denied having taken a bribe.
zh: 市长否认受贿。

en: The mayor screened his eyes with his hand.
zh: 市长用手遮住了眼睛。

en: The mayor presented him with the key to the city.
zh: 市长授予了他城市钥匙。

en: The mayor declared that he would announce the result of the investigation.
zh: 市长宣布他将公布调查结果。

en: The mayor felt that he should look into the loss of income from parking meters.
zh: 市长觉得他应该调查一下停车费收入减少的问题。

en: The Mayor addressed a large audience.
zh: 市长向众多观众发表了演讲。

en: The mayor addressed the general public.
zh: 市长向公众发表了讲话。

en: The mayor thought that he should investigate the decline in tax revenues.
zh: 市长觉得他应该调查一下税收减少的原因。

en: The mayor manifested his discontent with the new plan.
zh: 市长表达了对新计划的不满。

en: The mayor granted our request.
zh: 市长批准了我们的请求。

en: The mayor provided me with an identity card.
zh: 市长给我办了张身份证件。

en: The mayor governed the city very wisely.
zh: 市长把这座城市治理得很好。

en: The mayor prescribed to the citizens how to act.
zh: 市长向市民规定了该怎么做。

en: The mayor administers the affairs of the city.
zh: 市长管理着城市的事务。

en: The mayor acknowledged her services to the city.
zh: 市长认可了她对城市的贡献。

en: The mayor walked at the head of the procession.
zh: 市长走在游行队伍的最前面。

en: The mayor will shortly announce his decision to resign.
zh: 市长很快就会宣布辞职的决定。

en: The mayor is a stuffed shirt.
zh: 市长是个死板又爱摆架子的人。

en: The mayor compromised on the subject to a certain extent.
zh: 市长在那个问题上做出了一定的妥协。

en: The mayor will compromise to a certain extent.
zh: 市长会做出一定程度的让步。

en: As soon as they realized the mayor was on his way down, his critics started coming out of the woodwork.
zh: 一意识到市长要倒台了，那些批评他的人就都钻出来了。

en: The news of the mayor's resignation traveled fast.
zh: 市长辞职的消息传得飞快。

en: The mayor's family was harassed with threatening phone calls all day.
zh: 市长的家人整天被恐吓电话骚扰。

en: Beside the mayor, many other distinguished guests were present.
zh: 除了市长，还有很多贵宾出席了。

en: It's said that the mayor is on the take.
zh: 据说市长在贪污受贿。

en: The mayor is said to be on the take.
zh: 听说市长在拿回扣。

en: The mayor presented the prizes in person.
zh: 市长亲自颁发了奖项。

en: Octal paid a large grant for the researchers to carry out some market research.
zh: Octal拨了一大笔款给研究人员做市场调研。

en: The market drop has cleaned me out.
zh: 股市大跌让我赔了个精光。

en: The market was flooded with imports.
zh: 市场上到处都是进口货。

en: The market prices have fallen across the board.
zh: 市场价格全面下跌。

en: The market rallied.
zh: 股市反弹了。

en: The market was quiet today.
zh: 今天市场挺冷清的。

en: The market was flooded with foreign goods.
zh: 市场上充斥着洋货。

en: The market is glutted with cheap imports.
zh: 市场上全是廉价进口货。

en: How is it in the market?
zh: 市场上情况怎么样？

en: The municipal council should concentrate more on specific issues.
zh: 市议会应该多关注一些具体问题。

en: The city council meeting is a great place to sound off.
zh: 市议会会议是个发表意见的好地方。

en: The municipal council all but ignored the gravity of the pollution.
zh: 市议会对污染的严重性几乎视而不见。

en: There are few places downtown for parking, which is a serious problem.
zh: 市中心没几个停车位，这真是个大问题。

en: Because of the street fighting, the city is in utter confusion.
zh: 因为巷战，整个城市乱成了一团。

en: In the town there was a measure of peace.

zh: 孩子的体温比大人高。

en: Some kids start to carry on at a supermarket when they are not allowed to buy some candy or other treat.
zh: 有的孩子在超市里如果不给买糖吃，就会开始撒泼。

en: You can identify children's voices without any problem.
zh: 你能毫不费力地辨别出小孩的声音。

en: Children grow up so quickly.
zh: 孩子长得真快。

en: Early education for children usually begins at home.
zh: 孩子的早期教育通常是从家里开始的。

en: Keep out of reach of children.
zh: 放在孩子够不到的地方。

en: Please put this where children can't reach it.
zh: 请把这个放在孩子够不到的地方。

en: More Japanese are reluctant to have a child.
zh: 越来越多的日本人不想要孩子。

en: What are you, just an errand boy? Start thinking for yourself and give me something serious to work with.
zh: 你算什么，就一跑腿的？动动脑子，给我点像样的东西。

en: He would go fishing in the river when he was a child.
zh: 他小时候常去河边钓鱼。

en: I had a puppy when I was a boy.
zh: 我小时候养过一只小狗。

en: When I was a child, I played catch with my father.
zh: 我小时候经常和我爸玩接球。

en: When I was a kid, I played catch with my father.
zh: 我小时候常和我爸玩接球游戏。

en: I used to play alone when I was a child.
zh: 我小时候经常一个人玩。

en: I have a clear memory of my childhood.
zh: 我对童年的记忆很清晰。

en: I went to Canada when I was a child.
zh: 我小时候去过加拿大。

en: He used to play with her in his childhood.
zh: 他小时候经常和她一起玩。

en: When a child, I would play with the toys.
zh: 我小时候经常玩玩具。

en: As a child I learned lots of poems by heart.
zh: 我小时候背过很多诗。

en: In my childhood, I believed in Santa Claus.
zh: 我小时候相信有圣诞老人。

en: When I was a child, I believed in Santa Claus.
zh: 我小时候真的以为有圣诞老人。

en: When I was a child I would get so excited the night before a school excursion that my heart would be pounding and I couldn't sleep.
zh: 我小时候，学校郊游的前一天晚上总是兴奋得心怦怦跳，怎么也睡不着。

en: When a child, I used to go fishing with him.
zh: 小时候我经常跟他去钓鱼。

en: When I was a child, I could sleep anywhere.
zh: 我小时候在哪儿都能睡着。

en: As a boy, I used to swim in the pond.
zh: 我小时候经常去池塘里游泳。

en: When I was a child, I used to swim in that pond.
zh: 我小时候经常在那片池塘里游泳。

en: The child's shout was indeed shrill.
zh: 那个小孩的尖叫声确实很刺耳。

en: A child's education is the charge of his parents.
zh: 孩子的教育是父母的责任。

en: They called in a doctor because the child was ill.
zh: 因为孩子病了，他们请了医生。

en: We are in commission concerning the protection of children's rights.
zh: 我们正负责保护儿童权益的相关工作。

en: Joy was manifest on the child's face.
zh: 那个孩子脸上满是喜悦。

en: Knowing how much school for my kids is costing, it's impossible to relax with a beer and take it easy.
zh: 一想到孩子的学费有多贵，我就没法安心地喝着啤酒享清闲。

en: Does a child's musical talent depend on heredity?
zh: 孩子的音乐天赋是遗传的吗？

en: Young tigers resemble cats.
zh: 小老虎长得像猫。

en: I don't know how to handle children.
zh: 我不知道怎么跟小孩子相处。

en: My mother died when I was a kid.
zh: 我小时候我妈就去世了。

en: As a child, he went to Paris three times.
zh: 他小时候去过三次巴黎。

en: When he was a child, he went to Paris three times.
zh: 当他还是个孩子的时候，去过三次巴黎。

en: As a child, Bob lived in Boston.
zh: 鲍勃小时候住在波士顿。

en: From childhood I was fond of reading, and all the little money that ever came into my hands was laid out in books.
zh: 我从小就特别爱看书，手里只要攒下一点钱，就全拿去买书了。

en: I've known Jim ever since we were children.
zh: 我和吉姆从小就认识。

en: I've known Jim since my childhood.
zh: 我打小时候起就认识吉姆。

en: I've known Jim since I was a child.
zh: 我从是个孩子的时候起就认识吉姆了。

en: I've known Jim since we were children.
zh: 我和吉姆打小就认识。

en: Some lectures are not wholesome for children.
zh: 有些讲座不适合小孩子听。

en: He was innocent as a child.
zh: 他像孩子一样单纯。

en: Momoe would often play with me when she was a child.
zh: 百惠小时候经常陪我玩。

en: She could sing well when she was a child.
zh: 她小时候唱歌就很好听。

en: When I was a little child, I used to play baseball after school.
zh: 我小时候放学后经常打棒球。

en: I preferred baseball to football in my childhood.
zh: 我小时候比起足球更喜欢棒球。

en: As a child, I liked baseball better than football.
zh: 我小时候比起足球更喜欢打棒球。

en: I used to go fishing with my father when I was a child.
zh: 我小时候经常跟我爸去钓鱼。

en: When I was a child, I used to go to the seashore every summer.
zh: 我小时候每年夏天都去海边。

en: I was always told to study when I was a child.
zh: 我小时候总是被催着学习。

en: I always got up early in my childhood.
zh: 我小时候总是起得很早。

en: When I was a child, my mother made me eat green vegetables every day.
zh: 我小时候，我妈每天都逼我吃青菜。

en: When I was a child, I would often call on him on Sunday.
zh: 我小时候周日经常去找他。

en: When I was a child, I would often visit him on Sunday.
zh: 我小时候星期天经常去拜访他。

en: When I was a boy, I thought that I wanted to be a doctor.
zh: 我小时候想过要当一名医生。

en: I would often go swimming in the sea when a child.
zh: 我小时候经常去海里游泳。

en: When I was a child, I often went swimming in the sea.
zh: 我小时候经常去海里游泳。

en: When I was a kid, I often went to the beach to go swimming.
zh: 我小时候经常去海边游泳。

en: I am never free from worries about my child.
zh: 我总是为孩子操心。

en: When it comes to my child, the trouble never ends.
zh: 提到我孩子，麻烦事儿总是没完没了。

en: Taking the group of children to the library was no problem.
zh: 带这群孩子去图书馆没啥问题。

en: You shouldn't say such a thing in the presence of children.
zh: 这种话你不该当着孩子的面说。

en: You shouldn't say that kind of thing when children are around.
zh: 孩子在场的时候，你不该说那样的话。

en: All families with children get special rates.
zh: 带小孩的家庭都有优惠价。

en: A child's mischief often causes a fire.
zh: 小孩淘气经常会引起火灾。

en: Don't let your boy play with a knife.
zh: 别让你家孩子玩刀。

en: You shouldn't let children play with the kitchen knife.
zh: 你不该让孩子玩菜刀。

en: Children should not have more money than is needed.
zh: 孩子手里的钱不该超过他们需要的。

en: You shouldn't be impatient with children.
zh: 对孩子别那么没耐心。

en: Give a little love to a child, and you get a great deal back.
zh: 给孩子一点爱，你会得到很多回报。

en: We all believe in good, free education for our children.
zh: 我们都认为孩子应该接受良好的免费教育。

en: It is up to parents to teach their children manners.
zh: 教孩子懂礼貌是父母的责任。

en: Happy is he that is happy in his children.
zh: 能从孩子身上得到快乐的人是幸福的。

en: Don't be soft with kids.
zh: 对孩子别太心软。

en: Children should not be given more money than is needed.
zh: 不该给孩子超出他们需要的钱。

en: Children need many things, but above all they need love.
zh: 孩子需要很多东西，但最重要的是爱。

en: Children need a happy home environment.
zh: 孩子需要一个幸福的家庭环境。

en: There are many doubts to a child.
zh: 孩子心里总是有很多疑问。

en: What will a child learn sooner than a song?
zh: 还有什么能比儿歌让孩子学得更快呢？

en: A child needs love.
zh: 孩子需要爱。

en: A small boy needs some person he can look up to.
zh: 小男孩需要一个能让他崇拜的榜样。

en: Even a child can do it.
zh: 连小孩都能做。

en: Even children can understand it.
zh: 连小孩都能听懂。

en: You shouldn't let the children watch so much television.
zh: 你不该让孩子看这么多电视。

en: Physical contact with a child is very important.
zh: 和孩子的肢体接触非常重要。

en: Children filled the room.
zh: 屋里挤满了小孩。

en: Even a child is supposed to have reason.
zh: 就算是孩子也得讲道理。

en: Even children need to make sense of the world.
zh: 连小孩也需要去理解这个世界。

en: Even a child would notice the difference.
zh: 连小孩都能看出区别。

en: Even a child can understand it.
zh: 连小孩都能明白。

en: Even a child can answer it.
zh: 连小孩都能回答。

en: Child as she is, she is sociable.
zh: 虽然她还是个孩子，但很擅长社交。

en: Even a child knows right from wrong.
zh: 连小孩都知道是非对错。

en: Even a child can do such a thing.
zh: 这种事儿连小孩都能干。

en: Even a child can understand that.
zh: 那个连小孩都能听懂。

en: Even a child can answer the question.
zh: 这个问题连小孩都能回答。

en: Even a child can read this.
zh: 连小孩都能看懂这个。

en: Keep children away from medicine.
zh: 让孩子离药远点。

en: Let's take the children to the zoo.
zh: 咱们带孩子去动物园吧。

en: If you'll keep an eye on the kids, I'll take your suit to be cleaned.
zh: 如果你能帮我盯着点孩子，我就去帮你把西服送去干洗。

en: Don't spoil the children.
zh: 别把孩子惯坏了。

en: I took the children to school.
zh: 我送孩子去上学了。

en: Keep the children away from the knives.
zh: 别让孩子碰那些刀。

en: Don't let the children play on this street.
zh: 别让孩子在这条街上玩。

en: You must not allow the children to play here.
zh: 你千万不能让孩子在这儿玩。

en: Don't make fun of children.
zh: 别拿孩子开玩笑。
